title: What US city has the most futuristic appearance? - Quora
tags: Visiting and Travel in Cities and Metropolitan Areas

response.answer_text: Ennhhhh. Maybe Seattle, only for the space needle. US city’s don’t look futuristic! They look old and drab with collapsing bridges and failing infrastructure, but The Wall the corporations and the politicians are making on the southern boarder, that should be pretty futuristic, GREAT futuristic! But I’m betting on crumbling cities in the US for decades to come due to neglect and indifference in the sty of consumerism. Failure of nuclear energy facilities more prominent, and natural disasters awashed on every shore! Personal flying drones over the relics of our ancestors is what I imagine in the future! (sarcasm dripping) Internationally? Pudong, China and Dubai! LOL

Last weekend I went to a Giants game at PacBell, er… AT&T, er… oh wait, ORACLE Park in San Francisco and as I was approaching the City, I have to admit it was somewhat unrecognizable to me. The skyline has changed so much over the last decade that I wasn’t sure where I was on a freeway that I had traveled many, many times. From the Salesforce Tower to the Transamerica Pyramid, this could easily be a scene from one of many sci-fi or futuristic movies…
